  "article_text": [
    "suppose @xmath0 is a smooth compact manifold and @xmath1 is an anosov flow generated by a smooth vector field @xmath2 , @xmath3 .",
    "correlation functions for a flow are defined as @xmath4 where @xmath5 is a lebesgue density on @xmath6 .",
    "the power spectrum is defined as the ( inverse ) fourier - laplace transform of @xmath7 : @xmath8 faure  sjstrand @xcite proved that @xmath9 continues to a meromorphic family of operators on all of @xmath10 .",
    "using the fact that @xmath11 ( x ) $ ] this easily shows that @xmath12 has a meromorphic continuation .",
    "the poles of this continuation depend only on @xmath13 and their study was initiated in the work of ruelle @xcite and pollicott @xcite .",
    "they are called _ pollicott  ruelle resonances _ and their set is denoted by @xmath14 .",
    "the finer properties of the correlations are then related to the distribution of these resonances .",
    "this is particularly clear in the work of liverani @xcite and tsujii @xcite on contact anosov flows , see also nonnenmacher ",
    "zworski @xcite for semiclassical generalizations .    an equivalent definition of pollicott ",
    "ruelle resonances was given by dyatlov ",
    "zworski @xcite : they are limits ( with multiplicities ) of the eigenvalues of @xmath15 , @xmath16 , where @xmath17 is a laplacian for some riemannian metric @xmath18 on @xmath6 . because of a connection to brownian motion this shows stochastic stability of these resonances .    in this note",
    "we address the basic question about the size of the set of resonances : is their number always infinite ? despite the long tradition of the subject this appeared to be unknown for arbitrary anosov flows on compact manifolds . in theorem [ thm2 ] , we show that in sufficiently large strips the counting function of resonances can not be bounded by @xmath19 , @xmath20 .",
    "is the supremum of @xmath21 such that there are _ no _ resonances with @xmath22 , @xmath23 . for",
    "contact anosov flows it is known that @xmath24 @xcite,@xcite,@xcite .",
    "the _ essential spectral gap _",
    ", @xmath25 , is the supremum of @xmath21 such that there are only finitely many resonances with @xmath26 .",
    "our result states that the essential spectral gap is finite for any anosov flow on a compact manifold.,width=576 ]    general upper bounds on the number of resonances in strips were established by faure  sjstrand @xcite ( and with a sharper exponent in the case of contact flows by datchev  dyatlov  zworski @xcite ) : for any @xmath27 there exists @xmath28 such that @xmath29 on the other hand , for contact anosov flows satisfying certain pinching conditions on lyapunov exponents , faure ",
    "tsujii @xcite showed that the resonances satisfy a precise counting law in strips , agreeing with the upper bound of @xcite .",
    "that is a far reaching generalization of the results known in constant curvature : see dyatlov ",
    "guillarmou @xcite for recent results in that case and references .",
    "the new counting result is proved by establishing a local trace formula relating resonances to periods of closed trajectories and to the their poincar maps .",
    "hence we denote by @xmath30 periodic orbits @xmath31 of the flow , by @xmath32 the period of @xmath31 and by @xmath33 the primitive period .",
    "we let @xmath34 be the linearized poincar map ",
    "see  [ pr ] . with this notation we can state our _ local trace formula _",
    ":    [ thm1 ] for any @xmath35 there exists a distribution @xmath36 supported in @xmath37 such that @xmath38 in the sense of distribution on @xmath39 .",
    "moreover , the fourier transform of @xmath40 has an analytic extension to @xmath41 which satisfies , @xmath42    the trace formula can be motivated as follows . for the case of geodesic flows of compact riemann surfaces , @xmath43 , where @xmath44 is co - compact subgroup of @xmath45 , and @xmath46 is the geodesic flow , we have a global trace formula : @xmath47 here the set of resonances is given by @xmath48 ( up to exceptional values on the imaginary axis ) , where @xmath49 s are the eigenvalues of the laplacian on @xmath50 .",
    "this follows from the atiyah ",
    "guillemin trace formula and the selberg trace formula  see @xcite and references given there .",
    "the bound @xmath51 in is probably not optimal and comes from very general estimates presented in ",
    "[ estflt ] .",
    "it is possible that is valid for all anosov flows .",
    "melrose s poisson formula for resonances valid for euclidean infinities @xcite and some hyperbolic infinities @xcite suggests that could be valid for general anosov flows but that is unknown .    in general",
    ", the validity of follows from , but is not equivalent to , the finite order ( as an entire function ) of the analytic continuation of @xmath52 this finite order property is only known under certain analyticity assumptions on @xmath0 and @xmath46  see rugh @xcite and fried @xcite .",
    "the notation @xmath53 is motivated by the factorization of the ruelle zeta function  see ( * ? ? ?",
    "* ( 2.5 ) ) .    as a consequence of the local trace formula",
    ", we have the following weak lower bound on the number of resonances in a sufficiently wide strip near the real axis .",
    "it is formulated using the hardy - littlewood notation : @xmath54 if it is not true that @xmath55 .",
    "[ thm2 ] for every @xmath56 there exists a constant @xmath57 such that if @xmath58 , then @xmath59 in particular , there are infinitely many resonances in any strip @xmath60 for @xmath61 sufficiently large .",
    "* remarks . *",
    "an explicit bound for the constant @xmath62 is given by in the proof .",
    "this also gives an explicit bound @xmath63 for the essential spectral gap . in the case of analytic semiflows ( see @xcite ) frderic naud @xcite pointed out that a better estimate of the essential spectral gap is possible : there are infinitely many resonances in any strip @xmath64 , where @xmath65 is the topological pressure associated to the unstable jacobian  see and . in appendix [ weakmix ] , frdric naud shows how similar methods and theorem [ thm1 ] give a narrower strip with infinitely many resonances for weakly mixing anosov flows .    \\2 . in the case of flows obtained by suspending anosov maps",
    "the growth of the number of resonances in strips is linear  see appendix [ suspe ] by frderic naud for a detailed discussion of analytic perturbations of linear maps .",
    "that means that the exponent @xmath66 close to one is close to be optimal in general .",
    "the proof of theorem [ thm1 ] uses the microlocal approach to anosov dynamics due to faure  sjstrand @xcite and dyatlov ",
    "zworski @xcite .",
    "in particular we use the fact that @xmath67 and that the right hand side continues meromorphically with poles with integral residues . here the flat trace , @xmath68 , is defined using a formal integration over the diagonal , see  [ flat ] , with the justification provided by the crucial wave front set relation , see  [ wavefront ] .",
    "some of the techniques are also related to the proof of sjstrand s local trace formula for scattering resonances in the semiclassical limit @xcite .",
    "it is possible that an alternative proof of theorem [ thm1 ] could be obtained using the methods of giulietti  liverani ",
    "pollicott @xcite employed in their proof of smale s conjecture about zeta function ( @xcite provided a simple microlocal proof of that conjecture ) .",
    "the proof of theorem [ thm2 ] is based on the proof of a similar result in guillop ",
    "zworski @xcite which in turn was inspired by the work of ikawa @xcite on existence of resonances in scattering by several convex bodies .",
    "1*#1*.    we would like to thank semyon dyatlov for helpful discussions and in particular for suggesting the decomposition which simplified the wave front arguments .",
    "we are also grateful to frdric naud for sharing his unpublished work @xcite with us and to the anonymous referee for useful suggestions .",
    "this material is based upon work supported by the national science foundation under the grant and dms-1201417 .",

    "by @xmath83 we mean a ( small ) neighbourhood of @xmath84 in the space @xmath85 .",

    "this strategy for proving smale s conjecture on the meromorphy of ruelle zeta functions is the starting point of our proof of the local trace formula .",
    "the key step in the proof of the trace formula is the following estimate on the flat trace of the propagated resolvent .",
    "[ flattracees ] let @xmath235 and @xmath181 be given by and , and let @xmath236",
    ". then @xmath237 is well defined and holomorphic in @xmath238 when @xmath239 @xmath240 . moreover , in that range of @xmath238 , @xmath241    the proof is based on a quantitative study of the proof of ( * ? ? ?",
    "* theorem 8.2.4 ) and on the wave front properties established in @xcite .",
    "the general idea is the following : the wave front set condition shows that the trace is well defined .",
    "the analysis based on the properties of the semiclassical wave front set shows more : the contribution from a microlocal neighbourhood of fiber infinity is @xmath242 .",
    "the contribution away from fiber infinity can be controlled using the norm estimate on @xmath243 .",
    "since the weights defining the @xmath244 spaces are supported near infinity , the norm estimates are effectively @xmath245 estimates . for the proof of we first review the construction of the flat trace under the wave front set condition .",

    "we first indicate basic ideas of the proof before we go into the details  the principle is quite simple but the implementation involves the use of the results of @xcite and of some ideas from @xcite .    in general ,",
    "a trace formula such as follows from the finite order of the analytic continuation of @xmath441 in the strip @xmath442 , that is , from having the following estimate valid away from small neighbourhoods of resonances : @xmath443 to obtain the distributional identity we take @xmath444 and compute the following integral in two different ways @xmath445 on one hand , we pass the integral contour to @xmath446 , where @xmath447 so that converges . since there are no resonances in the upper half plane , we have @xmath448 guillemin s trace formula gives @xmath449 on the other hand , we pass the integral contour to @xmath450 and we get the contribution from the poles of @xmath451 which are exactly the pollicott - ruelle resonances , @xmath452 the remainder is exactly @xmath453 and we want to show that @xmath40 can be extended to a tempered distribution supported on @xmath454 and that it satisfies .",
    "the estimate is crucial here .",
    "to see , we decompose @xmath455\\\\ & \\ \\ \\ \\ - i\\int_0^{t_0}[e^{-it(p-\\lambda)}-e^{-it(p - i \\widetilde q-\\lambda)}]dt , \\end{split}\\ ] ] where @xmath456 for a suitably chosen @xmath457 depending on the range of @xmath458 s .",
    "this is valid from @xmath459 and then continues analytically to @xmath10 on the level of distributional schwartz kernels .",
    "the first term is holomorphic in @xmath192 and can be estimated by proposition [ flattracees ] in the semiclassical setting .",

    "* from the proof , we see that the essential gap is bounded by @xmath650 , where @xmath651 given above only depends on the poincar map associated to a primitive periodic orbit @xmath629 .",

    "by frdric naud    an anosov flow is called _ weakly mixing",
    "_ if @xmath656 this condition is not always satisfied for an arbitrary anosov flow : for example suspensions of anosov diffeomorphism by a constant return time are not weakly mixing . on the other hand , if the flow is _ volume _ preserving , anosov s alternative shows @xcite that it is _ either _ a suspension by a constant return time function _ or _ mixing for the volume measure and hence weakly mixing . assuming this weakly mixing property we will obtain a more precise strip with infinitely many resonances .",
    "the width of that strip is given in terms of a _ topological pressure _ and we start by recalling its definition .",
    "if @xmath114 is a real valued hlder continuous function , its topological pressure can be defined by the variational formula @xmath657 where the supremum is taken over all @xmath46-invariant probability measures , and @xmath658 is the kolgomogorov - sinai entropy .",
    "if in addition holds , that is if the flow @xmath99 is topologically weakly mixing , there exists an alternative way to compute the pressure using averages over closed orbits .",
    "let @xmath659 denote the set of periodic orbits of the flow and if @xmath660 let @xmath32 denote its period . then",
    "if @xmath661 we have the following asymptotic formula : @xmath662 this formula dates back to bowen @xcite  see ( * ? ? ?",
    "* chapter 7 , p.177 ) .",
    "notice that implies that one can find @xmath279 such that for all @xmath663 large , @xmath664 the case @xmath665 ( which will be considered here ) can be dealt with by applying the above lower bound to @xmath666 for a fixed @xmath667 .",
    "the function @xmath668 used in the estimate of the strip is the sinai - ruelle - bowen ( srb ) potential @xmath669 , defined as follows : @xmath670 where @xmath671 is the unstable subspace in @xmath672   2.1 .",
    "the potential @xmath673 is hlder continuous on @xmath0 and the associated invariant measure ( equilibrium state ) @xmath674 generalizes the liouville measure for flows : in general it is not absolutely continous with respect to the lebesgue measure but it is absolutely continuous on unstable leaves .",
    "we can now state the result giving a gap in terms of pressure :    [ thm3 ] suppose that @xmath6 is a compact manifold and @xmath675 is a _ weakly mixing anosov _ flow .",
    "let @xmath676 given by and @xmath677 be its pressure defined by .",
    "then for any @xmath678 we have @xmath679 where @xmath680 .",
    "* remark : * since we are concerned with anosov flows , we have automatically @xmath681",
    ". this implies , using the variational formula , that we have the bounds @xmath682 in particular this implies that if there exists a periodic orbit @xmath31 along which the unstable jacobian @xmath683 is close to @xmath684 , then the width of the strip with infinitely many ruelle - pollicott resonances is also small .",
    "this observation suggests that on the verge of non - uniformly hyperbolic dynamics , ruelle - pollicott resonances converge to the real axis .",
    "choose @xmath685 so that @xmath686 and that @xmath687 for @xmath688 .",

    ". then @xmath727 this gives a contradiction for all @xmath728 , concluding the proof .",
    "by frdric naud    let @xmath729 denote the @xmath643-dimensional torus and let @xmath730 be a smooth _ anosov diffeomorphism_. fix @xmath731 and consider the product @xmath732 $ ] .",
    "if one identifies each boundary components of @xmath733 through the rule @xmath734 , then the quotient , @xmath735 , is a smooth manifold .",
    "the vertical flow @xmath736 with the above identification is then well defined and is an anosov flow ( called the constant time suspension of @xmath737 ) .",
    "the purpose of this section is to compute the ruelle resonances of this particular family of anosov flows and show that they form a _ lattice _ which is related to ",
    "the suspension time \" @xmath738 and the ruelle spectrum of the anosov map @xmath737 , see for the exact formula .",
    "although the results are not surprising they do not seem to be available in the literature in the form presented here .",
    "calculations involving the ruelle zeta function for locally constant axiom a flows can be found in @xcite and what we show below is definitely close to the ideas in those papers . for simplicity",
    ", we will assume that @xmath737 is a _ small real analytic perturbation _ of a linear anosov diffeomorphism @xmath739 such that we have ( for @xmath667 small enough ) , @xmath740 where @xmath741 is a real - analytic map .",
    "a popular example of linear anosov map @xmath61 is the celebrated _ arnold s cat map _ induced by the @xmath742 element @xmath743    from the work of faure - roy @xcite , we know that there exists a hilbert space @xmath744 of hyperfunctions such that the transfer operator @xmath745 defined by @xmath746 is of trace class .",
    "in addition , we have the trace formula valid for all @xmath747 , @xmath748 where @xmath749 are the ruelle resonances of @xmath737 , ordered by decreasing modulus , @xmath750 , @xmath751 , where @xmath752 .",
    "the exponent @xmath753 defined modulo @xmath754 .",
    "we also recall from @xcite that @xmath755 and that the exponent @xmath756 is believed to be optimal . in what follows we will only use the trace formulas .",
    "we now proceed to compute the ruelle resonances of the flow by evaluating the dynamical side of the local trace formula .",
    "we use the same notations as before .",
    "let @xmath757 be a test function .",
    "using the fact that there is a one - to - one correspondence between primitive periodic orbits of the flow @xmath46 and periodic orbits of the map @xmath737 of the form @xmath758 where @xmath482 is the least period , we can write @xmath759 using the trace formula ( [ tr01 ] ) and exchanging summation order we get @xmath760    using the poisson summation formula we conclude that @xmath761 in other words , in the sense of distributions we have a global trace formula , @xmath762 theorem [ thm1 ] shows that for all @xmath35 this is equal to @xmath763 where @xmath586 is a distribution supported on @xmath764 whose fourier transform is analytic on @xmath765 .",
    "comparison with shows that that @xmath766 in the special case of _ linear _ anosov maps there is only one ruelle resonance at @xmath767 .",
    "( this can be seen immediately from the fact that @xmath768 so that for all @xmath769 the trace formula ( [ tr01 ] ) gives @xmath770 . )",
    "therefore the resonances of the suspension flow are given by @xmath771 .",
    "the fact that there are infinitely many real resonances is due to the absence of mixing of the flow ( the suspension time is constant ) .",
    "it is believed ( but not proved so far ) that typical anosov map should have infinitely many eigenvalues @xmath772 and therefore there should be , in general , infinitely many horizontal lines of resonances .",
    "j. sjstrand , _ a trace formula and review of some estimates for resonances _ , in _ microlocal analysis and spectral theory _",
    "( lucca , 1996 ) , 377437 , nato adv .",
    ", 490 , kluwer acad .",
    "publ . , dordrecht , 1997 ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> we prove a local trace formula for anosov flows . </S>",
    "<S> it relates pollicott  </S>",
    "<S> ruelle resonances to the periods of closed orbits . as an application </S>",
    "<S> , we show that the counting function for resonances in a sufficiently wide strip can not have a sublinear growth . in particular , for any anosov flow there exist strips with infinitely many resonances .    with appendices by frdric naud </S>"
  ]
}
